1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.

1�Greetings. I am 	 of the San d'Orian Provincial Knights.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the Bastokan Legion.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the Federation of Windurst.
1�Greetings. I am 	, Campaign Arbiter for the Allied Forces.
1�What can I help you with?Nothing.Performance assessment.New Allied Tags.Temporary items.Union registration.Teleportation.Information on the Allied Campaign.
1�You've already undergone an evaluation for this battle, or had you forgotten?As much as I'd like to, I'm forbidden from providing you with a new set of Allied Taegs until the next battle begins.

�!�I am sorry,  , but your campaign medal has expired. I cannot issue tags to anyone not authorized by the Allied Forces. Return to your nation's capital and speak with a Campaign Evaluation Official.

1�Complete transaction and return to capital?Yes.No.
1�What would you like to know?Nothing. I'm sorry.About performance assessment.About Allied Tags.About temporary items.About Unions.
1�Anyone wearing Allied Tags while participating in a campaign battle will be judged on their overall performance.
1�Soldiers will be evaluated not only on their fighting skills, but also on how much they contribute to the efforts of their allies through means such as healing and enhancing.
1�However, beware that if you leave the area before being assessed, you will be deemed a deserter and will forfeit all rewards earned that day.
1�Also, while there are no immediate penalties for being knocked out, falling in battle will significantly lower the score given to you.
1�When you are ready to receive compensation for your work on the field, return to me and I shall assess your performance and provide you with your payment.
1�That is all.
1�Allied Tags are a special type of identification given to all participants of Allied Campaign battles.
1�There are benefits, as well as drawbacks, to wearing the tags. One of the benefits is that in the case you are knocked out on the battlefield, you will not lose any experience points.
1�However, some of the drawbacks include the inability to improve skills and earn experience points for individual kills, as well as the right to loot fallen enemies.
1�That is all.
1�Temporary items can be purchased in exchange for Allied Notes.
1�There are several different varieties of items, but they all have one thing in common--they can only be used on the battlefield they were issued.
1�It is highly recommended that you first survey a battle's conditions and then select the supplies that you believe will benefit you most.
1�Please remember that all temporary items you carry on your person will be confiscated in the event that you leave the area.
1�That is all.
1�Oh ho! Keen to join a Union, are we?Very well. Listen up and I shall tell you all you need to know.

1�In order to better coordinate Allied efforts against the beastman menace, we have instituted a system of ad hoc tactical regiments called ??Unions.?? With five units to a battlefield, union registration is open to any proven soldier in possession of Allied Tags.
1�In return for their aid in advancing the war effort, union registrants will be eligible to earn a share of the spoils of war.

1�Needless to say, the choicest rewards will be reserved for those unions which make the greatest contributions in combat.Prove your mettle on the field of battle, and you will earn glory for your union, as well as a sizable bounty of your own.

1�Be forewarned that your commitment to your union comes first and foremost.In the aftermath of battle, you will not be permitted to reap rewards from your individual exploits until your union has distributed its plunder.
1�That is all.
1�Assist with the fortifications?Show them how it's done!Refuse to help.Ask for an explanation.
1�Choose a crystal!Fire crystal.Ice crystal.Wind crystal.Earth crystal.Lightning crystal.Water crystal.Light crystal.Dark crystal.Plumb give up.
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Purple, The New Black(pt.1).Purple, The New Black(pt.2).Purple, The New Black(pt.3).In the Name of the Father.The Long March North.Fork in the Road.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
..�Behold...
1�For emptiness itself is not to be sustained.The whole of creation abides right at this point.Both good and evil, both the sacred and the profane.
1�And all realities...
1�...Lilisette............Lilisette...
4�Portia!
1�But Master Mayakov!
1�I was worried for your well-being. This place is dangerous!
1�They say the Orcs have already occupied a substantial portion of the area.I have a feeling that something awful is going to happen here!
1�Don't you feel the same,  ?
1�No, no! That's not what I mean at all!Here, listen to this adventurer. ?[He/She] knows what will come to pass!
1�Well, it's simple, really... Though perhaps a bit difficult to believe...?[He/She] has come from......the future.
1�Why are you laughing!? Stop it right now! I'm serious!
1�Y-yes, sir!
1�Look! There!
1�It's that meddling furball! I knew it!
..�I certainly don't like the feel of this place...It's a bit creepy...
1�Sir Haudrale?A gentleman replies when addressed by a lady...
1�Portia, let us return!
1�D-demons!?
1�This will not be over quickly!
k!�Lilisette of the great Troupe Mayakov stands before you!Feel honor and privilege at your enemy this day!
m!�Huh
e!�Are you alright!?
1�Who are you fiends? What are you!?
1�Hold there!
1�Halt! Accept your defeat!
1�What are you going on about...?
1�Wh-what was that!?
1�Wait... Please wait! Don't go!I'm here... Right here! Please...
1�...Portia...Thank the Goddess...you're alright...
1�Sir Ragelise... Where is he? Is he alright?
1�No! It can't be! Not again!
..�...Father! Father, can you hear me?
1�Father, please wake up!Father! Don't leave me!
1�The once flourishing roots of the Great Star Tree were all but withered away... I saw...
1� , did you see? Did you see it as well?
1�No! We mustn't move him. Look at his wound.It will only eat away at his body as he becomes weaker.If we attempt the journey to the city walls now, his condition will only worsen!
1� , I wonder if you haven't already noticed by now.I realize there is no use in trying to hide it from you.
1�I'm an adventurer, just as you are.I've come here from the Vana'diel of many years past...
1�That man, Ragelise of the house of Baloumat and leader of the Knights of the Ironcrest Hawk.He is my...father.
1�Ten years or so from now, that...wound, or curse, or whatever it is...It will cause my father to fall irreparably ill...and eventually claim his life.
1�So when I heard about the cavernous maws and these bygone days of Vana'diel, I had but a single thought.

1�My mother once told me that my father suffered his wound serving at the Battle of Jeuno.I thought that if only I could somehow prevent him from going into that battle... If only I could...I thought the wound could be avoided.
1�It made such perfect sense to me. I already know what has happened in this world.I already know what will happen after this. I have learned of all these events as history in the future.
1�And yet...there was nothing I could do. He has still been struck by the same blow.
1�But things are changing! History is changing,  .Like the events we witnessed back at La Vaule. My father's diary contained no such entries or recollections. Not even in passing!
1�But still...
1�That mysterious feline...!
1�She too is attempting to change the course of history.Only if she were to have her way, things would sway in favor of the Beastman Confederate!
1�Just you watch!I am going to make that cat wish that she never crossed my path!
1�And I will save my father!
1�And what are your plans from here,  ?Do you intend to keep the promise you made?
1�Are you even listening to me? After everything I've just told you?Isn't that exactly what that stupid cat told you to do!?
1�But wait! Oh, oh, oh, wait just a second.That's so crazy...it just might work!If we pretend to be doing what she has told us...
1�That's it!By making it appear as though we are doing her bidding, she will surely make it a point to contact us again!
1�Nice thinking,  ! You may be a bit more clever than I gave you credit for.I just might keep you around!
1�Not a bad team, you and I!
1�So we do exactly as she tells us, and then we go to a place she is likely to show herself and maybe make a little noise.And then as soon as she shows her little face, we've got her!
1�So she wants us to stop the flow of tears, does she?Hmph! Well, I don't suspect a single one will be shed over her. So no harm done!
1�Hehehehehehe.
1�Lilisette? Is that you?What are you doing here?
1�Little Lilisette, dear. You must realize that now isn't the time to be joking.
1�Sir Ragelise...
1�Even at a time such as this you tease me so...
1�Sir Haudrale, where exactly do you intend to take these townspeople?
1�Lilisette!
1�Mr. Mayakov, she's awake! Lilisette is awake!
1�You needn't be worrying about me now, child. I'll be just fine.
1�You gave me quite the shock there.Just fainting like that all of a sudden. I thought you had all taken ill by the work of some magic.
1�All the while he was carrying you, he was joking and in good spirits as always.
1�Father?
1�The Great Star Tree? What ever are you talking about? Are you feeling alright, Lilisette?
..�Sir Ragelise!
1�He's passed out again! Oh my, I do hope he's alright...Whatever could be wrong...
1�Very well, then. Let us take him back to the monastery.Many of the holy men there are knowledgeable in the ways of medicine.
1�What are you doing here!? The enemy is nearly upon us, you know?This is no place for you to be!
1�Never mind, we need all the help we can get for now.All of you, come! You two, as well!
1�Knights of the Madder Falcon!How fare you?
1�It does me well to hear that.Though I must say from the looks of things you seem to have taken your fair share of lashings as well.
1�Leave the rest up to us. We shall see to it from here.You and your men see to the defense of the local populace first and foremost.

1�For some reason the Orcs have gone to great lengths in assaulting this location.Though I can't for the life of me figure out why. It is nothing more than a sleepy little town and the monastery is the only substantial structure.
1�We must deliver a crippling blow to their ranks and force them to move elsewhere.Otherwise, I fear they will simply continue their relentless siege until nothing is left.
h!�Away! Away from the houses! Now!
1�Composure, knight! It is nothing more than the scare tactics of mere pigmen.Abandon the homes. Concentrate all hands on evacuation of the people.
1�So now they show their true selves...The Dark Kindred!
1�Do not give yourself to despair.Demon or no, if it bleeds, we can kill it.Let them strike no fear in your heart!
1�Let us show them how the Kingdom welcomes its guests!
1�The enemy comes!Order of the Ironwing Butterfly! See the women and children to safety!
1�All other units, we will hold the enemy here! This is where we fight!
1�Very well. I place them in your charge.
1�Wait a moment...You... Your face is not familiar to me. State your name and rank, knight.
1�You needn't worry, Portia.Surely you don't think I would allow myself to die surrounded by men!
1� ! Lilisette! Portia!Go now, and may the Goddess watch over you!
t?�Aye, had you expected to find me any other way?By our hand, the Dark Kindred have pulled back.
1�Yes, I granted temporary command of the dancer unit to Sir Haudrale of your Madder Falcons.They departed shortly thereafter.
e!�I sensed that something foul was afoot the moment I laid eyes on you.Far too well-spoken and mannered to pass for one of the rugged Madder Falcons.
1�Oh, don't go puzzling yourself over anything you may have seen.Those Dark Kindred's stock and trade is deceiving their enemy.
1�Worried...much...?Aaaah...
1�Lilithette! Have you neglected your lethonth to come here?Return at onthe! Your behavior ith unactheptable!
1�Lilithette, we have all come here prethithely becauthe it ith fraught with danger.We are bound to defend our home at any cotht!
1�You've brought along a friend with you, I thee.
1�And may I athk how it ith prethithely that ?[he/she] is thomehow already privy to eventh that have yet to unfold, hm?
a!�Hahahahahaha!!!
1�Leave matterth here to uth.Go now, all of you!
1�They are ethcorting the townthpeople to thafer ground.
1�It lookth like the'th going to be alright.
1�With the help of Thir Ragelithe, we were able to carry you here to thafety.
1�Calm yourthelf, child. He ith thtill breathing.He collapthed there right after carrying you here.I imagine he mutht be quite tuckered out.
1�Lilithette, I wonder if you haven't gone and banged your head thomewhere.What are you going on about now!?
1�Let uth get him back to the thity, quickly.The royal doctorth there will be able to do thomething for him.
1�How could you pothibly know tho much about thith?It doethn't thound like thith ith your firtht time theeing thuch a wound...
1�A good idea.Are you able, Lilithette? Come, then.
1�And Commander of the Knights of the Rustwing Hawk, Haudrale, at your most humble service.
1�By the command of Lady Lilith, we came to pay you dear ladies a small visit.
1�But it seems you have quite persistent guardians watching over you. More so than anticipated...
1�Aquila, I leave these knaves to you.Tear them limb from limb.
1�Silence!Or would you prefer I place my own blade once again in that slack jaw of yours?
1�<Sigh>... This always seems to be the way of things when he loses.Such a child...
1�Until we meet again, then.
..�Behold...
1�For emptiness itself is not to be sustained.The whole of creation abides right at this point.Both good and evil, both the sacred and the profane.
1�And all realities...
1�Sooorry about that. Got lost along the way, I did.
1�Me too, me too! Leader of the Cryptscale Protectorate, Aquila!It is sooo nice to meet you. And I truly mean that.
1�Again?Why do I always get stuck with the dirty work? It really doesn't suit me, I think.
1�Fine, fine. But you really aren't good at dealing with people, you know that?
1�Sorry, but I have to do this. I promise I'll try to make it as painless for you as possible.
e!�It's not faaair!
1�What did you do to my Galarhigg!?
u?�<Sniffle>...
1�Sir Ragelise! What has kept you? You have missed all the excitement.We have only just finished doling out our latest flogging to those accursed Orcs!
1�Never mind that!
1�Still, your arrival will do much to set the men at ease.
1�Yes? What news from the mark?
1�So their latest attack was a diversion after all...
1�That is most excellent news!At last we have our revenge for the Battle of La Theine!
1�What happened to the others?The dancer girl and her company?
1�Haudrale? My lord, there is no knight by that name in the Knights of the Madder Falcon.Perhaps you are mistaken?
1�I regret to inform you, Sir Ragelise, that acting commander Faurezelle of the Ironwing Butterfly is nowhere to be found.
1�My lord!
1�It is as we feared, sir.
1�L-Lilisette? Is that you?Lilisette of Troupe Mayakov!?
1�How can this be!?The flames... They are everywhere!
1�Then the rumors are true! The evil from the north has rallied the Orcs and Quadav to its call!
1�Curse it all! How could the fires have erupted everywhere so suddenly!?My lord! We will not be able to extinguish them all in time!
1�If it pleases my lord, I shall lead in his stead.
1�Haudrale of the Knights of the Madder Falcon, sir!
1�We haven't the manpower to repel the enemy.To the west of here is the entrance to an underground cavern.I shall guide the troupe and the townspeople.
1�Hehehe.
1�Was the journey to your liking? Allow me to offer my apologies.I realize it may be neither the most appropriate escort nor location for such ladies of your refinement.
1�Hmph. Most perceptive.
!?�Unfortunately, I haven't the time or the patience to contend with your futile interruptions.
1�Aquila, you are late.
1�Pardon my impudence. I have gone and totally forgotten to introduce myself.Spitewarden of Lady Lilith...
t.�Unsure, I am. All this talk of...Champions, was it?Sounds a bit off to me. Not too right.
1�And what say you, Ceithir?Are we to think that they simply passed through Atomos? Right on through?
1�Have we not all overlooked a terribly important issue? Quite forgotten.
1�Aon and Ochd's brushes with danger are quite the cause for concern. Quite the cause.Now, of all times, we cannot afford to be careless.
c.�Then there is indeed someone attempting to impede our work? To slow us down?
1�Intrigues and perplexes...
1�Nyahahaha! Look at you all, idling away. Idle, idle thoughts.Surely she is up to something. Plots and plans of her own.
1�Work to be done!
l!�It's as Coig has just told us. Just informed us.How is it those two have come to be here?
1�Enough!Silence, silence, silence! Quiet!
1�If you please, Tri is attempting to say something. Speaking up.
!?�That is most perplexing. Most intriguing.
l.�Oh well, so sorry to have bothered.Most important is that we stay the course at hand. Our hands on course.Our work here will not be compromised. No compromises.
1�Aon and Dha, that's enough out of you two.Nothing but complaints from the both of you. All I ever hear.
1�Now that you mention it...

1�I do seem to recall, there was a brazen young lass. Accused me of being nothing more than a common cat, she did.Chased me about for quite a spell before I was finally able to lose her. Lost her, I did.
1�Indeed? Indeed?Then I shall see to keeping an eye on her and her underling. A careful cait's eye.I leave our endeavors elsewhere up to the rest of you.
1�Then see to it! Take care of it!
1�That is all for now. For now, that is all.
1�Looks like we've got the ingredients we came for,  .Now, all we need to do is spice them up a bit...and we'll have a dish that'll be the hit of the party!
1�As for the cinders... If my memorrry serves, these are used in the casting of what we call 5????.
1�I'll leave them to you.We'll give those beastmen a welcome they won't soon forget.
1�But they've sealed their gates tight to outsiders ever since the war began...
1�But you already know what I'm thinking...don't you,  ?
1�May the Goddess protect you!
?!�Which battlefield will you enter?None.Splitting Heirs (S).Purple, The New Black.The Blood-bathed Crown............................
